result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brave A Cannon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brave A Cannon in court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Brave A Cannon.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is in compliance with the deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant needs to complete the essay and firearm safety class in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 10.12.22

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled.

Defendant Brave A Cannon in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  
Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defendant in court.  Court ordered the stayed warrant vacated.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court.  
Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for DPA hearing.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brave A Cannon in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  
Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Matter set for DPA hearing.  Atty. Klimetz requests another date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brave A Cannon in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Defendant is scheduled to get a TAD evaluation and Atty. Klimetz requests a DPA hearing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

The $3,500 Cash Bail previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Brave A Cannon in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 16.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
